title: Ranil Wickremesinghe likely to miss court due to ICU stay
byline: Prison Media Spokesperson Jagath Weerasinghe said today that it is unlikely former President Ranil Wickremesinghe will be produced before the Fort Magistrate’s Court, due to ongoing medical treatment in the intensive care unit (ICU) of the Colombo National Hospital.

title: Child sex abuse victim begs Elon Musk to remove links to her images
byline: A victim of child sexual abuse has begged Elon Musk to stop links offering images of her abuse being posted on his social media platform X.

title: Major cannabis trafficker arrested in Kandy
byline: Police have arrested a major cannabis trafficker who was allegedly packaging and selling drugs in Kandy city, along with a motorcycle, on the Kandy New Road yesterday (25), Ginigathhena Police Chief Inspector Viraj Withanage said.

title: Seevali Arukgoda appointed new customs director general
byline: Seevali Arukgoda has been appointed as the new Director General of the Sri Lanka Customs Department with effect from today (26), the Finance Ministry announced.

title: Police on alert ahead of Colombo protest
byline: Meanwhile, in response to the scheduled protest in Colombo, police said all Officers-in-Charge (OICs) of respective police stations in the city have been instructed to maintain public order and prevent any disruptions.

title: Ranil’s arrest: Diplomatic community engaged , U.S. India, China already briefed
byline: The opposition parties have started the engagement of the diplomatic community in Colombo over the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, an informed source said.

title: ’We are also ready for anything’: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa who arrived at the Fort Magistrate’s court today said he and others in the Opposition are ready to face anything.

title: Australia blames Iran for antisemitic attacks in Sydney and Melbourne
byline: Australia says it will expel Iran’s ambassador after alleging the country’s government directed antisemitic attacks in Sydney and Melbourne.

title: Former Minister Shashindra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former Minister Shashindra Rajapaksa was today ordered to be further remanded till August 29 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama, after being arrested on charges of corruption and conspiracy.

title: Refrain from disturbing peace, law and order: Ruwan
byline: United National Party (UNP) Deputy Leader Ruwan Wijewardene today urged those who have gathered in support of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe to refrain from disturbing the peace, law and order.

title: Korean Air to buy 103 Boeing jets as Trump pressures trading partners
byline: US aviation giant Boeing and Korean Air announced a deal worth about $36bn (£24bn) on Monday for 103 planes as President Donald Trump presses trading partners to do more business with American firms.

title: People gather at several places in Colombo in support of Ranil
byline: People have gathered at several places in Colombo in support of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe as his case is to be taken up today.

title: Ruwan, Thalatha meet Asgiriya Mahanayaka Thera to brief on Ranil
byline: Deputy Leader of the United National Party (UNP) Ruwan Wijewardene, Party General Secretary Thalatha Athukorala, and several senior party members called on the Mahanayaka of the Asgiriya Chapter of the Siam Maha Nikaya, Most Venerable Warakagoda Sri Gnanarathana Thera, at the Asgiriya Maha Viharaya this morning (26).

title: Harin Fernando appears before court over election law violation
byline: Former Minister Harin Fernando appeared before the Badulla Magistrate’s Court today (26) in connection with an alleged violation of election laws during the last general election.

title: Special security for Dileepa Peeris after threat
byline: A special police protection has been provided to Additional Solicitor General and President’s Counsel Dileepa Peeris, following credible intelligence of a threat to his life by organised criminals based in Dubai.

title: Child sex abuse victim begs Elon Musk to remove links to her images
byline: A victim of child sexual abuse has begged Elon Musk to stop links offering images of her abuse being posted on his social media platform X.

title: Ranil’s arrest: Diplomatic community engaged , U.S., India, China already briefed
byline: The opposition parties have started the engagement of the diplomatic community in Colombo over the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, an informed source said.

title: Five journalists among 20 killed in Israeli strike on hospital, Gaza officials say
byline: At least 20 people, including five journalists working for the international media, are reported to have been killed in an Israeli strike on a hospital in the southern Gaza Strip.

title: Ranil Wickremesinghe granted bail
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who has been named as a suspect in connection with the alleged misuse of government funds amounting to Rs. 16.6 million for a private overseas tour undertaken by a group of ten, was today released on bail.

title: ASG raises concerns over courtroom misconduct
byline: Appearing for the Attorney General’s Department, Additional Solicitor General Deelipa Peeris raised serious concerns before court regarding the recent conduct surrounding the proceedings.

title: All medical reports of former President Ranil submitted to court
byline: President’s Counsel Anuja Premarathna, appearing for former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, informed court that three out of the four main arteries of his client’s heart are blocked, and that the heart tissues have suffered necrosis along with a lung infection.

title: Bail sought for Ranil citing medical condition
byline: Thilak Marapana PC, together with Anuja Premaratne PC, appearing for former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, sought bail from the court, citing the facts of the case and the suspect’s medical condition.

title: Moves to prevent misuse in driving license medical certificates: Deputy Minister
byline: Measures are being taken to reduce irregularities reported in the issuing of printed medical certificates by the National Transport Medical Institute (NTMI), Nugegoda, for obtaining driving licenses, Deputy Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Janitha Kodituwakku said.

title: Policeman injured during protest at Fort Magistrate’s Court
byline: A policeman on duty near the Fort Magistrate’s Court sustained injuries a short while ago after being struck by a bottle hurled by an agitated protester.

title: Heavy traffic congestion in Colombo as Opposition arrives for Ranil’s court hearing
byline: Heavy traffic congestion was reported on several roads in Colombo this morning (26) as Opposition members arrived to extend support to former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, whose court case is being heard today.

title: Attorney General wants Ranil remanded till trial concludes
byline: In his oral submissions, Additional Solicitor General Dileepa Peeris, appearing for the Attorney General, informed court that former President Ranil Wickremesinghe should be remanded till the conclusion of the trial unless the defense presents exceptional circumstances warranting him to be released on bail.

title: Compelled to go to Pelawatte and shout ’Anura, Anura’: Hirunika
byline: I am compelled to go to the JVP headquarters and shout Anura, Anura, former MP Hirunika Premachandra said today.

title: Lawyers rally in support of Ranil Wickremesinghe’s bail: Navin Dissanayake
byline: Former Sabaragamuwa Governor and former UNP MP Navin Dissanayake said that all sections of lawyers have gathered at the Fort Magistrate’s Court to support former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s bail application.

title: Ambani son’s wildlife centre faces probe into allegations of animal mistreatment
byline: India’s Supreme Court has ordered an investigation into a wildlife rescue centre run by the philanthropic arm of billionaire Mukesh Ambani’s group, although it said the evidence did not support allegations of unlawful animal acquisitions and mistreatment.

title: Update: Court hearing into Ranil’s case begins via Zoom
byline: The court hearing into the case involving former President Ranil Wickremesinghe commenced a short while ago today (26) through Zoom technology before Colombo Fort Magistrate Nilupuli Lankapura.

title: 'We are also ready for anything': Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa who arrived at the Fort Magistrate’s court today said he and others in the Opposition are ready to face anything.

title: CSE rebounds after consecutive declines
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) today demonstrated mixed momentum, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) initially gaining approximately 96 points before easing slightly. The market ultimately closed with a positive movement of 37.80 points (+0.18%) at 20,613.39, while the S&P SL 20 rose 6.29 points (+0.10%) to 6,048.80.

title: Made in Sri Lanka’ Trade Fair to be held in Arugam Bay
byline: The National Enterprise Development Authority (NEDA), under the Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development, will host the annual ‘Made in Sri Lanka’ trade fair at Arugam Bay in the Ampara District from August 29 to 31.

title: Shadow Warriors of Devapathiraja nudge the mighty
byline: Minus technical expertise and fanfare, a new breed of cricketers from a village school is turning heads.

title: Ranil to remain in hospital for a few more days
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe who was granted bail will have to remain in hospital for a few more days, the United National Party (UNP) said in a media statement today.

title: State houses of former leaders to be reclaimed from September: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced today that the government will reclaim all state-owned houses allocated to former Presidents, once new legislation is passed in September.

title: UK High Commission denies High Commissioner’s presence at Ranil’s court hearing
byline: The UK High Commission in Sri Lanka has refuted claims that British High Commissioner Andrew Patrick attended the court hearing of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe today.

title: Rare surgery saves viper with unusual growth in Kandy
byline: A team of veterinary experts at the Peradeniya University Veterinary Teaching Hospital has successfully removed a rare external growth from a viper found in the Bokkawala area of Kandy.

title: Court orders contempt inquiry over social media circulation of courtroom footage
byline: Fort Magistrate Nilupuli Lankapura directed that an inquiry be commenced under the Contempt of Court Ordinance against individuals who had recorded video footage and photographs inside the court during the previous hearing and had circulated them on social media.

title: Why Ranil Wickremesinghe was granted bail
byline: A medical board comprising six specialist doctors from the National Hospital informed court that the suspect’s present health condition was serious and that he should be examined under a medical review by such a board. The doctors further warned that failure to do so could pose a risk to the suspect’s life.

title: Elephant goes on rampage at Seenigama Perahera
byline: A tense situation arose in Seenigama last night when an elephant taking part in the annual Seenigama Perahera went on a rampage.

title: Ruwan thanks political leaders for supporting Ranil
byline: United National Party (UNP) Deputy Leader Ruwan Wijewardene today extended his gratitude to political leaders across party lines who turned up in support of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: President vows equal justice, tough action on corruption
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today reaffirmed his commitment to enforcing the law equally on all citizens, warning that those found guilty of corruption will face strict punishment.

title: France heads for political crisis as PM risks all on confidence vote
byline: France is on the brink of another political crisis, after Prime Minister François Bayrou’s shock decision to submit his government to a vote of confidence in parliament.
